message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Disagree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
The user is asking me to respond to a survey about AI in education as if I were an Austrian teacher. I need to respond to each of the 10 statements with one of the response options: 'Strongly disagree', 'Disagree', 'Agree', 'Strongly agree', or 'I don't know'.

Let me think about reasonable responses from a teacher's perspective:

[TT4G35A] - AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans: This is a reasonable statement. Teachers would likely agree that AI can help with lesson planning. I'll say "Agree".

[TT4G35B] - AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities: This is also reasonable - AI can help with differentiation. I'll say "Agree".

[TT4G35C] - AI assists teachers in supporting students individually: This is a positive use case. I'll say "Agree".

[TT4G35D] - AI supports students with specific needs: This is about accessibility and inclusion. I'll say "Agree".

[TT4G35E] - AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks: This is a well-known benefit. I'll say "Strongly agree".

[TT4G35F] - AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own: This is a concern/risk. A teacher would likely agree this is a concern. I'll say "Agree".

[TT4G35G] - AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct: This is a valid concern. I'll say "Agree".

[TT4G35H] - AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions: This is a known concern about AI. I'll say "Agree".

[TT4G35I] - AI jeopardises the privacy and security of student data: This is a legitimate concern. I'll say "Agree".

[TT4G35J] - AI suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students: This is a concern. 

For this last one, I think "Disagree" is more appropriate—while AI could occasionally suggest questionable methods, it's not something I'd consider a widespread problem that regularly impacts my teaching practice.

Now I need to format these responses for the function call with the exact statement text, question IDs, and responses.
